meanings.definition: Formed by the collection of units or particles.
meanings.sent1: The aggregative data showed the total number of votes cast.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the aggregative behavior of ants in a colony.
meanings.sent3: The aggregative clouds in the sky resembled fluffy cotton candy.
meanings.sent4: Her smile had an aggregative effect on everyone in the room.
meanings.sent5: The aggregative power of teamwork led to their victory.

meanings.definition: Tending to aggregate or group together.
meanings.sent1: The aggregative tendencies of the students made them form study groups.
meanings.sent2: The aggregative nature of social media brings people with similar interests together.
meanings.sent3: The aggregative ducks waddled closely together in the pond.
meanings.sent4: His aggregative personality drew friends to him effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The aggregative force of magnetism pulled the metal objects closer.
